content:
That's a great clue! With Mark's recommendation and Alex's previous success with the lure, I think it's likely that the spot is indeed Taylor Creek. Taylor Creek is a popular fishing spot near Lake Tahoe, and it's known for its bass fishing.

As you mentioned, Alex caught a bass with the same lure on your last trip, which suggests that the lure is effective in that area. Taylor Creek is a good spot for bass fishing, especially near the mouth of the creek where it flows into Lake Tahoe.

If you're staying near Taylor Creek, it's definitely worth trying out the spot. Just make sure to check the local fishing regulations and obtain any necessary permits before you head out. Additionally, be respectful of the environment and other anglers, and practice catch-and-release fishing to help conserve the lake's fish population.

If you're still unsure, you could try contacting Mark at the tackle shop to confirm the location and get any additional tips or advice. He might be able to provide more specific information about the spot and what to expect.

Good luck on your fishing trip, and I hope you and your friends have a great time on the water!
